text: DIGEST:
label: BODY

text: 1. 'Rejection of proposal which does not conform
label: BODY

text: to specification requirement is proper, even
label: BODY

text: though offeror asserts its nonconforming pro-
label: BODY

text: posal for data conversion represents modern,
label: BODY

text: state-of-the-art approach that would be
label: BODY

text: significantly less costly to Government.
label: BODY

text: Any complaint concerning specifications
label: BODY

text: should have been filed prior to closing date
label: BODY

text: for receipt of proposals.
label: BODY

text: Agency determinations regarding technical
label: BODY

text: merits of proposals will be questioned by GAO
label: BODY

text: only upon showing of unreasonableness. Where
label: BODY

text: record shows strong disagreement between agency
label: BODY

text: evaluators and offeror concerning minimum
label: BODY

text: effort necessary to accomplish work, value and
label: BODY

text: relevance of offeror's prior experience and
label: BODY

text: reliability of offeror's technical approach,
label: BODY

text: but does not demonstrate that evaluators'
label: BODY

text: position is unreasonable, evaluation and
label: BODY

text: resultant award to higher-rated offeror will
label: BODY

text: not be disturbed.
label: BODY

text: Agency may properly utilize its own reasonable
label: BODY

text: estimates of manhours needed to perform work to
label: BODY

text: measure offerors' understanding of requirements.
label: BODY

text: Sogitec, Incorporated (Sogitec) protest /award of a
label: BODY

text: contract by the Ce
label: BODY

text: 1 IntelliqenceLAaencyto Atlantic
label: BODY

text: Associates, Inc. (Atlantic) under request for proposals
label: BODY

text: (RFP) No. 9-79A. The solicitation requested fixed-price
label: BODY

text: proposals to convert hardcopy data into machine readable
label: BODY

text: magnetic tape format.
label: BODY

text: Sogitec contends its technically
label: BODY

text: sound proposal offering the lowest price should not
label: BODY

text: have been rejected by the agency.
label: BODY

text: cij~
label: BODY

text: L S o iE it 1n
label: H1

text: The RFP informed offerors award would be made to that
label: BODY

text: responsible offeror whose offer conforming to the solici-
label: BODY

text: tation would be most advantageous to the Government, price
label: BODY

text: and other factors considered. The right-to accept other
label: BODY

text: than the lowest offer was specifically reserved. The RFP
label: BODY

text: stated that while cost proposals would be used to assess
label: BODY

text: an offeror's understanding of the requirements and the
label: BODY

text: validity of its approach, cost would be of less importance
label: BODY

text: than the combined technical and management evaluation
label: BODY

text: factors.
label: BODY

text: Sogitec's initial proposal provided for using optical
label: BODY

text: character recognition equipment and for keying entries
label: BODY

text: directly from raw data without use of a Data Conversion
label: BODY

text: Form required by the specification, which mandated tran-
label: BODY

text: scribing to the form prior to keying. Sogitec was
label: BODY

text: informed its proposal was deficient because it did not
label: BODY

text: stipulate a data transcription task and did not provide
label: BODY

text: an estimate of manhours by labor category. The agency
label: BODY

text: then amended the RFP to make clear that the requirement
label: BODY

text: to transcribe the entries meant to handwrite them.
label: BODY

text: In its
label: BODY

text: best and final offer, Sogitec submitted an Option A which
label: BODY

text: provided for such handwritten transcription and an Option
label: BODY

text: B which retained the approach of direct keying without
label: BODY

text: transcribing. The price for Option B was less than half
label: BODY

text: of the awarded contract price.
label: BODY

text: Sogitec's Option B approach was found to be unaccept-
label: BODY

text: able because it did not provide for handwritten data tran-
label: BODY

text: scription as required by the solicitation. Option A, while
label: BODY

text: acceptable, received the lowest technical evaluation score
label: BODY

text: among the four competing proposals. This low score
label: BODY

text: reflected the evaluators' concerns that Sogitec had no prior
label: BODY

text: experience in library conversion activities, that its
label: BODY

text: estimate of manhours for the data preparation phase was
label: BODY

text: less than half of the agency's internal estimate, and that
label: BODY

text: the proposal was weak in certain areas! and reflected a lack
label: BODY

text: of understanding of the complexity of what was required.
label: BODY

text: Atlantic, which received the second highest technical
label: BODY

text: rating, was awarded the contract on the basis of its high
label: BODY

text: overall numerical scores which indicated that on the
label: BODY

text: basis of both technical and price considerations, that
label: BODY

text: firm's proposal was most advantageous to the Government.
label: BODY

text: Sogitec's major complaint is that the agency rejected
label: BODY

text: its Option B proposal without considering that it reflected
label: BODY

text: a current state-of-the-art approach and that the handwritten
label: BODY

text: transcription approach was unnecessary. The determination
label: BODY

text: of the minimum needs of an agency and the methods of accom-
label: BODY

text: modating them, however, are properly the responsibility of
label: BODY

text: the agency. Maremont Corporation, 55 Comp. Gen. 1362 (1976),
label: BODY

text: Here the agency believes the handwritten
label: BODY

text: requirement is essential to insure accuracy since the data
label: BODY

text: entries come from many different libraries, each using its
label: BODY

text: own format, and in various states of legibility. While
label: BODY

text: Sogitec contends that it offered a more modern and improved
label: BODY

text: approach obviating the handwritten transcription step, it
label: BODY

text: has not shown, on this record, that the agency's insistence
label: BODY

text: on the transcription is without a rational basis.
label: BODY

text: In any
label: BODY

text: event, the specifications required the handwritten tran-
label: BODY

text: scription and the agency therefore was required to reject
label: BODY

text: any proposal that did not conform to those specifications,
label: BODY

text: regardless of the lower price that might be associated with
label: BODY

text: such a proposal. Any objection Sogitec has regarding the
label: BODY

text: requirement should have been filed prior to the closing
label: BODY

text: date for receipt of proposals or, after the RFP was amended,
label: BODY

text: prior to the next closing date for receipt of revised pro-
label: BODY

text: With respect to its Option A proposal, Sogitec defends
label: BODY

text: its own manhour estimate, asserts the value of its prior
label: BODY

text: experience and questions how the awardee could have a stronger
label: BODY

text: technical approach than Sogitec offered.
label: BODY

text: We point out that it is not the function of our Office
label: BODY

text: to evaluate the technical merits of proposals or to substi-
label: BODY

text: tute our judgment for that of the procuring agency as to
label: BODY

text: which offeror should have received the award. Therefore,
label: BODY

text: technical evaluations and award determinations by procuring
label: BODY

text: agencies will be questioned by our Office only upon a clear
label: BODY

text: showing that they were arbitrary or unreasonable or incon-
label: BODY

text: sistent with the established evaluation factors.. Group
label: BODY

text: Operations Incorporated, 5:5- Comp-. Gen. 1315, (1-976), 76-2
label: BODY

text: CPD 79. While it is clear that there is much disagree-
label: BODY

text: ment between Sogitec and the agency, we find no basis for
label: BODY

text: conc uding that the agency's determinations were unreasonable
label: BODY

text: or otherwise improper.
label: BODY

text: First, with regard to the agency's internal estimate of
label: BODY

text: required manhours, the agency reports that based on its own
label: BODY

text: experience, it estimated 2.5 minutes for handwritten
label: BODY

text: transcription, 1.25 minutes for review and editing each
label: BODY

text: entry and six productive hours in an eight hour workshift
label: BODY

text: for a total of five minutes per entry for the data pre-
label: BODY

text: paration phase, whereas Sogitec estimated.it would take
label: BODY

text: approximately two minutes for the same tasks. Sogitec
label: BODY

text: states that its manhour estimate was based on simulating
label: BODY

text: actual production, asserts that the va~ri.ance in estimates
label: BODY

text: "should have nothing to do with the award evaluation,"
label: BODY

text: and questions the relevance of the agency's concern with
label: BODY

text: manhours when a fixed-price contract was to be awarded.
label: BODY

text: The propriety of an agency's use of its own independ-
label: BODY

text: ent estimates as an aid in determining the acceptability
label: BODY

text: of proposals is well established. Such estimates may per-
label: BODY

text: tain both to cost, Raytheon Company, 54 Comp. Gen. 169
label: BODY

text: (1974), 74-2 CPD 137, and to items which contribute to
label: BODY

text: costs such as required manhours.
label: BODY

text: These estimates are entitled to great weight and an agency's
label: BODY

text: reliance on them will not be disturbed so long as they
label: BODY

text: are reasonable. Teledyne Lewisburg, Oklahoma Aerotronics,
label: BODY

text: Although Sogitec apparently believes it can accomplish
label: BODY

text: the work with significantly less manhours than the agency
label: BODY

text: thinks is necessary, it has not shown that the agency's
label: BODY

text: estimate and reliance thereon is unreasonable. At best,
label: BODY

text: there is a difference in judgment, and of course the
label: BODY

text: agency's good faith judgment must prevail in situations
label: BODY

text: such as this.
label: BODY

text: Consequently, we cannot object to the
label: BODY

text: agency's use of its own best estimate of manhour require-
label: BODY

text: ments. The fact that a fixed-price contract is involved
label: BODY

text: does not negate the propriety of the agency 's actions --
label: BODY

text: the agency's concern was not with what the awardee would
label: BODY

text: be legally bound to do under a fixed-price contract,
label: BODY

text: but with the. offeror's understanding of what would be
label: BODY

text: required.
label: BODY

text: (The technical evaluation panel felt that "it
label: BODY

text: is unrealistic to expect a high quality product" to result
label: BODY

text: from the time Sogitec proposed to devote to data pre-
label: BODY

text: paration.)
label: BODY

text: With respect to prior experience, Sogitec concedes that
label: BODY

text: it had no library conversion experience, but refers to its
label: BODY

text: work with aerospace technical manuals and asserts that it
label: BODY

text: "stated that it has several employees with much experience
label: BODY

text: in library conversion jobs." The agency evaluators found,
label: BODY

text: however, that Sogitec's aerospace engineering background
label: BODY

text: was not "very applicable" to the current project and that
label: BODY

text: the Sogitec proposal did not show that Sogitec's employees
label: BODY

text: had a library conversion background. The record supports the
label: BODY

text: evaluators' position on the latter point and the former point,
label: BODY

text: of course, is a judgment matter within the discretion of the
label: BODY

text: evaluators.
label: BODY

text: Finally, the evaluators believed Sogitec's approach was
label: BODY

text: weak because of the low manhour estimate and because of
label: BODY

text: Sogitec's plan for detecting keying errors, which the
label: BODY

text: evaluators considered to be unreliable for the amount of data
label: BODY

text: involved. That judgment has, not been shown to be unreasonable.
label: BODY

text: In short, we find that- the agency properly rejected
label: BODY

text: Sogitec's nonconforming Option B and that the evaluation of
label: BODY

text: Sogitec's Option A has not been shown to be unreasonable.
label: BODY

text: The protest is denied.
label: BODY

text: For The Comptroller General
